3401.definition: [μιμέομαι] middle voice from μῖμος (a "mimic"); to imitate

3403.definition: [μιμνήσκω] a prolonged form of {{G3415}} (from which some of the tenses are borrowed); to remind, i.e. (middle voice) to recall to mind

3404.definition: [μισέω] from a primary μῖσος (hatred); to detest (especially to persecute); by extension, to love less

3408.definition: [μισθός] apparently a primary word; pay for service (literally or figuratively), good or bad

3409.definition: [μισθόω] from {{G3408}}; to let out for wages, i.e. (middle voice) to hire

3412.definition: [Μιτυλήνη] for μυτιλήνη (abounding in shellfish); Mitylene (or Mytilene), a town on the island of Lesbos

3413.definition: [Μιχαήλ] of Hebrew origin ({{H4317}}); Michael, an archangel

3414.definition: [μνᾶ] of Latin origin; a mna (i.e. mina), a certain weight

3415.definition: [μνάομαι] middle voice of a derivative of {{G3306}} or perhaps of the base of {{G3145}} (through the idea of fixture in the mind or of mental grasp); to bear in mind, i.e. recollect; by implication, to reward or punish Compare {{G3403}}.

3416.definition: [Μνάσων] of uncertain origin; Mnason, a Christian

3417.definition: [μνεία] from {{G3415}} or {{G3403}}; recollection; by implication, recital

3418.definition: [μνῆμα] from {{G3415}}; a memorial, i.e. sepulchral monument (burial-place)

3419.definition: [μνημεῖον] from {{G3420}}; a remembrance, i.e. cenotaph (place of interment)

3421.definition: [μνημονεύω] from a derivative of {{G3420}}; to exercise memory, i.e. recollect; by implication, to punish; also to rehearse

3423.definition: [μνηστεύω] from a derivative of {{G3415}}; to give a souvenir (engagement present), i.e. betroth

3424.definition: [μογιλάλος] from {{G3425}} and {{G2980}}; hardly talking, i.e. dumb (tongue-tied)

3425.definition: [μόγις] adverb from a primary μόγος (toil); with difficulty

3426.definition: [μόδιος] of Latin origin; a modius, i.e. certain measure for things dry (the quantity or the utensil)

3427.definition: [μοί] the simpler form of {{G1698}}; to me

3428.definition: [μοιχαλίς] a prolonged form of the feminine of {{G3432}}; an adulteress (literally or figuratively)

3432.definition: [μοιχός] perhaps a primary word; a (male) paramour; figuratively, apostate

3433.definition: [μόλις] probably by variation for {{G3425}}; with difficulty

3434.definition: [Μολόχ] of Hebrew origin ({{H4432}}); Moloch (i.e. Molek), an idol

3437.definition: [μομφή] from {{G3201}}; blame, i.e. (by implication), a fault

3438.definition: [μονή] from {{G3306}}; a staying, i.e. residence (the act or the place)

3441.definition: [μόνος] probably from {{G3306}}; remaining, i.e. sole or single; by implication, mere

3444.definition: [μορφή] perhaps from the base of {{G3313}} (through the idea of adjustment of parts); shape; figuratively, nature

3445.definition: [μορφόω] from the same as {{G3444}}; to fashion (figuratively)

3446.definition: [μόρφωσις] from {{G3445}}; formation, i.e. (by implication), appearance (semblance or (concretely) formula)

3447.definition: [μοσχοποιέω] from {{G3448}} and {{G4160}}; to fabricate the image of a bullock

3448.definition: [μόσχος] probably strengthened for όσχος (a shoot); a young bullock

3449.definition: [μόχθος] from the base of {{G3425}}; toil, i.e. (by implication) sadness

3450.definition: [μοῦ] the simpler form of {{G1700}}; of me

3451.definition: [μουσικός] from Μοῦσα (a Muse); "musical", i.e. (as noun) a minstrel

3452.definition: [μυελός] perhaps a primary word; the marrow

3453.definition: [μυέω] from the base of {{G3466}}; to initiate, i.e. (by implication) to teach

3454.definition: [μῦθος] perhaps from the same as {{G3453}} (through the idea of tuition); a tale, i.e. fiction ("myth")

3455.definition: [μυκάομαι] from a presumed derivative of μύζω ( to "moo"); to bellow (roar)

3456.definition: [μυκτηρίζω] from a derivative of the base of {{G3455}} (meaning snout, as that whence lowing proceeds); to make mouths at, i.e. ridicule

3458.definition: [μύλος] probably ultimately from the base of {{G3433}} (through the idea of hardship); a "mill", i.e. (by implication), a grinder (millstone)

3460.definition: [Μύρα] of uncertain derivation; Myra, a place in Asia Minor

3461.definition: [μυριάς] from {{G3463}}; a ten-thousand; by extension, a "myriad" or indefinite number

3463.definition: [μύριοι] plural of an apparently primary word (properly, meaning very many); ten thousand; by extension, innumerably many

3464.definition: [μύρον] probably of foreign origin (compare {{H4753}}, {{G4666}}); "myrrh", i.e. (by implication) perfumed oil

3465.definition: [Μυσία] of uncertain origin; Mysia, a region of Asia Minor

3466.definition: [μυστήριον] from a derivative of μύω (to shut the mouth); a secret or "mystery" (through the idea of silence imposed by initiation into religious rites)

3467.definition: [μυωπάζω] from a compound of the base of {{G3466}} and ὤψ (the face; from {{G3700}}); to shut the eyes, i.e. blink (see indistinctly)

3468.definition: [μώλωψ] from μῶλος ("moil"; probably akin to the base of {{G3433}}) and probably ὤψ (the face; from {{G3700}}); a mole ("black eye") or blow-mark

3469.definition: [μωμάομαι] from {{G3470}}; to carp at, i.e. censure (discredit)

3470.definition: [μῶμος] perhaps from {{G3201}}; a flaw or blot, i.e. (figuratively) disgraceful person

3471.definition: [μωραίνω] from {{G3474}}; to become insipid; figuratively, to make (passively, act) as a simpleton

3473.definition: [μωρολογία] from a compound of {{G3474}} and {{G3004}}; silly talk, i.e. buffoonery

3474.definition: [μωρός] probably from the base of {{G3466}}; dull or stupid (as if shut up), i.e. heedless, (morally) blockhead, (apparently) absurd

3475.definition: [Μωσεύς]   or Μωσῆς,  or Μωϋσῆςof Hebrew  origin; ({{H4872}}); Moseus, Moses, or Mouses (i.e. Mosheh), the Hebrew lawgiver

3476.definition: [Ναασσών] of Hebrew origin ({{H5177}}); Naasson (i.e. Nachshon), an Israelite

3477.definition: [Ναγγαί] probably of Hebrew origin (compare {{H5052}}); Nangæ (i.e. perhaps Nogach), an Israelite

3478.definition: [Ναζαρέθ]   or Ναζαρέτ;  of uncertain derivation; Nazareth or Nazaret, a place in Palestine

3479.definition: [Ναζαρηνός] from {{G3478}}; a Nazarene, i.e. inhabitant of Nazareth

3480.definition: [Ναζωραῖος] from {{G3478}}; a Nazoræan, i.e. inhabitant of Nazareth; by extension, a Christian

3481.definition: [Ναθάν] of Hebrew origin ({{H5416}}); Nathan, an Israelite

3482.definition: [Ναθαναήλ] of Hebrew origin ({{H5417}}); Nathanaël (i.e. Nathanel), an Israelite and Christian

3483.definition: [ναί] a primary particle of strong affirmation; yes

3484.definition: [Ναΐν] probably of Hebrew origin (compare {{H4999}}); Nain, a place in Palestine

3485.definition: [ναός] from a primary ναίω (to dwell); a fane, shrine, temple  Compare {{G2411}}.

3486.definition: [Ναούμ] of Hebrew origin ({{H5151}}); Naum (i.e. Nachum), an Israelite

3488.definition: [Νάρκισσος] a flower of the same name, from νάρκη (stupefaction, as a "narcotic"); Narcissus, a Roman

3489.definition: [ναυαγέω] from a compound of {{G3491}} and {{G71}}; to be shipwrecked (stranded, "navigate"), literally or figuratively

3491.definition: [ναῦς] from νάω or νέω (to float); a boat (of any size)

3493.definition: [Ναχώρ] of Hebrew origin ({{H5152}}); Nachor, the grandfather of Abraham

3494.definition: [νεανίας] from a derivative of {{G3501}}; a youth (up to about forty years)

3495.definition: [νεανίσκος] from the same as {{G3494}}; a youth (under forty)

3496.definition: [Νεάπολις] from {{G3501}} and {{G4172}}; new town; Neapolis, a place in Macedonia

3497.definition: [Νεεμάν] of Hebrew origin ({{H5283}}); Neeman (i.e. Naaman), a Syrian

3498.definition: [νεκρός] from an apparently primary νέκυς (a corpse); dead (literally or figuratively; also as noun)

3499.definition: [νεκρόω] from {{G3498}}; to deaden, i.e. (figuratively) to subdue
